line_1: And round his Pris'ner shut the plated Doors;
line_2: Here the pleas'd Youth his charming Prey secures,

line_2: The blazing Roofs enlighten all the Floors:

line_1: The solemn aisles, and death-denouncing doors,
line_2: The dim sunk eye, with hopeless glance, explores

line_1: The walls were crack'd, decay'd the doors,
line_2: The corn lay mouldy on the floors;

line_1: And courtiers I turn out of doors,
line_2: By this distinction all your whores

line_1: And careful nature all her doors
line_2: All creatures batten o'er their stores,

line_1: Haste, close the window, bar the doors,
Passing from room to room, the brazen doors
line_2: Resound, as when exploded thunder roars.

line_1: Or stands before the Nurs'ry Doors,
line_2: To take the naughty Boy that roars:

line_1: I' the city's busy streets, by rich men's doors,
line_2: On whose white steps the flower-girl sets her stores,

line_1: His Rails, his Windows, and his Doors,
Restraint, as slighted stranger at their doors!
line_2: Where Grandeur revels in unbounded stores;

line_1: Shakes his straw roof, and jars his bolted doors:

line_2: The Chance of War whilst he deplores,

line_1: And so brought their Food within Doors.
line_2: And for Winter they lay up their Stores:
